body:
Comment 2 by **wwaites**: 
Further investigation, signal(7) man page on most recent ubuntu linux 11.04 (which was
my source for saying Linux supports this) says:

       SIGPWR      29,30,19    Term    Power failure (System V)
       SIGINFO      29,-,-             A synonym for SIGPWR

       ...

       SIGPWR (which is not specified in POSIX.1-2001) is typically ignored by default on those other Unix sys-
       tems where it appears.

however it does not actually appear in the system headers on x86 (the three columns in
the man page
apparently have somethign to do with different architectures).

A numeric value of 29 as documented in the man page would not be surprising as that is
typically what is found with BSD...

I wonder what the portable alternative is...
